                     Faculty & Staff    The ranks of Stern professors and guest lecturers include some of the city's-and the world's-most innovative business thinkers and successful practitioners. Our professors not only have have many years of academic experience, but also are veteran professionals. Through their efforts, the department aims to create the next generation of leaders in accounting. To learn more about our faculty, review our faculty profiles here . Please address all inquiries to Tim Baldenius, Department Chair. tbaldeni@stern.nyu.edu                                        Department of Accounting   NYU Stern Henry Kaufman Management Center 44 West 4th Street Suit 10-180 New York, NY 10012 Tel: 212-998-0010 Fax : 212-995-4230/4004                                                              Faculty & Staff     Full-Time Faculty   Visiting Faculty   Emeritus Faculty   Adjunct Faculty   Visiting Scholars   Administration & Staff                           News      NYU Stern Center for Business and Human Rights to Tackle Migrant Labor Rights in the Construction Industry    Foreign Policy Association Awards Medal to Dean Peter Henry    Follow @NYUStern on Twitter and like NYU Stern on Facebook         Basics      Directions & Maps    Faculty Directory    Contact Us                                 FACULTY OPINIONS    Read Stern faculty opinions on  relevant business topics             Sitemap | Privacy | © 2015 Leonard N. Departments / Department of Accounting / Academic Programs / Undergraduate                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                               Welcome to the website of the Undergraduate Program in Accounting at the Stern School of Business  The Accounting academic degree program at Stern consistently has been ranked among the top ten of the most highly regarded undergraduate programs in the United States. This website provides a comprehensive collection of materials to assist the Stern undergraduate student in selecting course electives for a most effective Accounting major or co major - one that will best prepare you for a most successful professional career upon graduation. Accounting is central to effective management of business enterprises and is a key component in the proper functioning of the free market system. There are many rewarding career opportunities in accounting and related professions such as security analysis, investment banking, corporate finance, banking and taxation. Feedback from students, alumni and recruiters suggest that there is, and continues to be, numerous job opportunities for students who major or double major in Accounting and closely related fields such as Finance and Information Systems. We have subsequently developed curricula options for an Accounting major and co majors designed to most effectively prepare the Stern undergraduate student for today's professional career marketplace upon graduation. Alex Dontoh Director of the Undergraduate Program in Accounting                         Academic Programs     Undergraduate Course Descriptions   Curriculum   Career Prospects   Societies     MBA   PhD Overview   CPA BS/MS   Master Course Schedule                           News      NYU Stern Center for Business and Human Rights to Tackle Migrant Labor Rights in the Construction Industry    Foreign Policy Association Awards Medal to Dean Peter Henry    Follow @NYUStern on Twitter and like NYU Stern on Facebook         Basics      Directions & Maps    Faculty Directory    Contact Us                                 FACULTY OPINIONS    Read Stern faculty opinions on  relevant business topics             Sitemap | Privacy | © 2015 Leonard N.
